solution.text:
Area of tin sheet required for 1 box = Surface area of one box
\(= 2 (4 \times 8 + 8 \times 8 + 4 \times 8) = 256 cm^2\)
Therefore, area of tin required for 12 boxes \(= 256 \times 12\)
\(= 3072 cm^2\)

content.text: You need to create a tin box of dimensions \(4 cm \times 8 cm \times 8 cm.\) What is the area of a sheet of tin required to make 12 such tins?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area of the box

content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 416 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(416 m^2\)
Therefore, \(416 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{416}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{4}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 2 metres

content.text: What is the Height of the cuboid?

hint.text: Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2 (lb + bh + lh)\)

solution.text:
The surface area of the box \(= 2 (23 \times 18 + 18 \times 7 + 23 \times 7) = 1402 cm^2\)
Cost of painting the box = Rs. 2.2 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the box = \(1402 \times 2.2\)
= Rs. 3084.4

content.text: Latika needs to paint a rectangular box from the outside. The cost of painting the box is Rs. 2.2 per \(cm^2.\) If the dimensions of the box are \(23 cm \times 18 cm \times 7 cm\), what is the total cost of painting the box?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area

solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times 3.3^2 = 326.7 cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(3.3^2 cm^2 = 10.89 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = 326.7 - 108.9 = 217.8 \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs 4 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(217.8 \times 4\)
= Rs. 871.2

content.text: Five cubes of edge 3.3 cm each are placed side by side and stuck together as shown. The cost of painting is Rs 4 per \(cm^2\). What is the cost of painting the outer surface of the entire object?

hint.text: Count the number of faces that are outward facing

solution.text:
Total surface area \(= 6 \times 14^2 = 6 (side)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Length of side = \((\frac {1176}{6})^{\frac 12} = 14 cm\)

content.text: A closed box in the shape of a cube has a total outer surface area of 1176 \(cm^2.\) What is the length of its side in centimetres?

hint.text: Remember that surface area of a cube is \(6 \times side^2\)

solution.text:
Curved Surface area of the roller \(= 2 \pi rh = 2\pi \times \frac {8}2 \times 31 = 779.43 cm^2\)
Area covered per rotation \(= 779.43 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area painted in 51 rolls \(= 779.43 \times 51 = 39750.86 cm^2\)

content.text: Last Monday, Ram painted a rectangular wall with a cylindrical paint roller. The length of the roller is 31 cm and its diameter is 8 cm. While painting, the roller rolled over 51 times completely. What surface area did Ram paint?

hint.text: How much area does the roller cover in one rotation?

solution.text: Surface Area of a cube = \(6 \times length^2 = 96 cm^2\)

solution.text: Surface Area of a cuboid = \(2(ab + bc + ca) = 2 (1012.5 + 337.5 + 675) = 4050 dm^2\)

content.text: See the cuboid below, a=45 dm, b=22.5 dm, c=15 dm, Find its surface area

solution.text: Surface Area of a cylinder = \(2 \times \pi \times r \times(r + h) = 1617 cm^2\)

content.text: In the cylinder below, diameter=21 cm, h=14 cm, find its surface area

solution.text:
Surface Area = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2\pi ({r_ o}^2 - {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 3080 + 2640 + 326.86 = 6046.86 cm^2\)
